is the principal port on the virginal west coast of the
in Indonesia. While the town itself is rather rough and unattractive, there are vast gorgeous white sand beaches stretching for miles and kilometers and miles to the north and south.
A visit to Bukit Barisan Selatan National Park, or surfing at Karang Nyimbor, Tanjung Setia, is highly recommended.
Accommodation is relatively undeveloped in this remote region of Lampung Province, and few people are fluent in English.

value: directions=in Tanjung Setia, some 20km south of Krui
